contentrichtext.text: Several ships of the [[Royal Navy]] have been named '''HMS ''Liberty'''''. *{{HMS|Liberty|1768}} was a [[sloop]] belonging to [[John Hancock]] confiscated by the Royal Navy in 1768 for failure to pay customs duties. She was commissioned under Captain William Reid as a revenue ship. In July 1769 she seized two Connecticut vessels and brought them into [[Newport, Rhode Island]]. A group of [[Rhode Island Army National Guard|Newport citizens]] boarded the ship, smashed her lifeboats, cut down her masts and cables, and set her adrift. She ran aground on a small nearby island and then burned. *{{HMS|Liberty|1779|6}} was a cutter purchased in 1779, later re-rigged as a brig, and sold in Barbados in 1816. *HMS ''Liberty'' - a sailing brig sunk in a collision in 1804. *HMS ''Liberty'' - sailing brig serving as a tender to ''Lion'' in 1901. *HMS ''Liberty'' was a paddle steamer/mine sweeper originally named ''Roslin Castle and renamed ''Wanderer'' in 1913. *{{HMS|Liberty|1913}}, launched in 1913, was a [[Laforey class destroyer (1913)|''Laforey''-class]] [[destroyer]] that served in [[World War I]], fought at the [[battle of Jutland]] in 1916, and was broken up in 1921. *{{HMS|Liberty|J391|6}}, launched in 1943, was an [[Algerine class minesweeper|''Algerine''-class]] [[minesweeper (ship)|minesweeper]] that served in [[World War II]]. She was sold to the [[Belgian Navy]] in 1949 and renamed ''Adrien de Gerlache''. {{Shipindex}} {{Italic title prefixed|3}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Liberty, Hms}} [[Category:Royal Navy ship names]]
